transcript:
Patient: Some of the most effective coping strategies I've learned are using thought records to challenge negative thoughts, practicing self-care activities like exercise and hobbies, and reaching out for support when I need it. I've also found the relaxation techniques, like progressive muscle relaxation, to be really helpful when I'm feeling overwhelmed.

Therapist: Those are all excellent strategies, Emilio. It's clear that you've developed a robust set of tools to support your mental health. Let's add those to your wellness action plan. We can also include some specific reminders of your new, more balanced beliefs about yourself and your worth. What are some of the key reframes or affirmations you'd like to include?

Patient: I think one of the most important reframes for me is the idea that my worth isn't tied to my family's expectations or approval. I am worthy of love and respect just as I am. Another helpful affirmation is that I have the strength and resilience to cope with challenges and setbacks.

Therapist: Those are powerful and meaningful reframes, Emilio. Let's add those to your plan as well. It can be helpful to have those reminders readily available when you're feeling distressed. Another important aspect of your wellness action plan is identifying sources of support. Who are some of the people in your life that you feel comfortable reaching out to when you need help?

Patient: I have a few close friends who have been really supportive of my mental health journey. I also have a cousin who has struggled with depression herself, and she's always been understanding and empathetic. And, of course, I know that I can always reach out to you if I need professional support.

Therapist: It's wonderful that you have those supportive relationships in your life, Emilio. Reaching out for help can be difficult, but it's a crucial part of maintaining your mental health. Remember, you don't have to go through this alone. I'm always here to support you, whether through booster sessions or just a check-in.

Patient: Thank you, that means a lot to me. I feel like I have a solid plan in place now for managing my mental health going forward.

Therapist: You've done an incredible job of developing that plan, Emilio. I have full confidence in your ability to continue using these skills and strategies independently. As we wrap up our work together, I want to take a moment to acknowledge the progress you've made. You've shown so much courage and resilience in facing your challenges and working towards a healthier, more fulfilling life. I am truly proud of you.

Patient: Thank you so much, Nova. I couldn't have done it without your support and guidance. I feel like I've grown so much through this process.

Therapist: It's been an honor to support you on this journey, Emilio. Remember, this isn't the end of your growth and healing. It's just the beginning of a new chapter. You have the tools and the strength to continue moving forward, one step at a time.

Patient: I believe that now. Thank you for everything, Nova.

Therapist: Before we end our session, let's do a quick check-in. How are you feeling right now?

Patient: I'm feeling a mix of emotions, to be honest. I'm a bit sad that our regular sessions are ending, but I also feel proud of the work I've done and hopeful about the future.

Therapist: That's completely understandable, Emilio. It's normal to feel a mix of emotions at the end of therapy. I want to remind you that you're not alone in this. You have a support system, and you can always reach out to me if you need additional support in the future. For now, let's assign some homework to help you continue practicing your skills. I'd like you to review your wellness action plan regularly and practice using your coping strategies when you face challenges. You can also continue to use your thought records and practice self-care activities. How does that sound?

Patient: That sounds great. I'll definitely keep practicing my skills and using my wellness action plan.

Therapist: Wonderful. I have full faith in your ability to continue this work independently. If you ever need a refresher or some extra support, don't hesitate to reach out. You've got this, Emilio.

Patient: Thank you, Nova. I appreciate everything you've done for me.

Therapist: It's been my pleasure, Emilio. I'm so proud of the progress you've made and the person you've become. I wish you all the best on your continued journey.

Session Summary:
- Main topics discussed:
  - Reviewed Emilio's progress and the skills he's learned throughout therapy
  - Created a wellness action plan for maintaining gains and managing potential setbacks
  - Discussed strategies for accessing social support and professional help if needed
  - Acknowledged Emilio's growth and resilience and celebrated his achievements
  - Assigned homework to continue practicing skills and using the wellness action plan
  - Checked in on Emilio's current mood and explored his thoughts and feelings about ending therapy
- Techniques or exercises used:
  - Review of coping strategies learned throughout therapy (thought records, reframing, self-care, relaxation techniques)
  - Creation of a wellness action plan with specific steps for managing early warning signs and accessing support
  - Reinforcement of new, more balanced beliefs about self-worth and resilience
  - Encouragement of social support and professional help-seeking
  - Assignment of homework to continue practicing skills and using the wellness action plan
  - Regular check-ins on Emilio's mood and exploration of his thoughts and feelings
- Homework assigned:
  - Review wellness action plan regularly
  - Practice using coping strategies when facing challenges
  - Continue using thought records and practicing self-care activities
  - Reach out for support if needed
- Patient's progress, challenges, depression symptoms, and important personal details:
  - Emilio reported feeling a mix of emotions, including pride, sadness, and hopefulness
  - He has made significant progress in developing coping strategies and more balanced beliefs about himself
  - Emilio's cultural background and family dynamics may continue to pose challenges, but he has developed skills to manage these challenges more effectively
  - He may need ongoing support to maintain gains and manage potential setbacks
- Core beliefs and intermediate beliefs:
  - Core belief: "I am worthy of love and respect, even if my family doesn't always understand or accept me."
  - Intermediate belief: "I have the strength and resilience to cope with challenges and setbacks."
- Any important information to carry forward to future sessions:
  - Emilio's goals for therapy have been met, and he has developed a solid set of tools and strategies to manage his depression independently
  - He may benefit from periodic booster sessions or additional support in the future, particularly during times of stress or transition
  - Emilio's progress and resilience should be acknowledged and celebrated, while also recognizing that maintaining gains will be an ongoing process
- Plan for the next session:
  - As this is the final scheduled session, there is no plan for a next session at this time. Emilio is encouraged to reach out for support as needed and to consider scheduling booster sessions in the future if he feels he needs additional support.
